snippet: To the Editor:    Abigail Trillin (Op-Ed, May 19) believes that when making the argument for bilingual education, she should not ''substitute anecdote for fact.'' Yet some anecdotes elucidate the facts of bilingual education....
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Abigail Trillin (Op-Ed, May 19) believes that when making the argument for bilingual education, she should not ''substitute anecdote for fact.'' Yet some anecdotes elucidate the facts of bilingual education.
abstract: Jonathan Raff letter points out that many California schools are trying to boost enrollments in bilingual classes by putting native English speakers in program (S)

headline.main: Data Are In: Bilingual Classes Fail
